member.name: T:ENode.EQueue.DomainEventHandledMessage
member.summary: Represents a message contains the information of the handled domain event.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.DomainEventHandledMessage.CommandId
member.summary: Represents the unique identifier of the command.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.DomainEventHandledMessage.AggregateRootId
member.summary: Represents the aggregate root created or modified by the command.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.DomainEventHandledMessage.Items
member.summary: Represents the extension information of the domain event.

member.name: T:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage
member.summary:
Represents a message when a command is executed.
This message not means all the domain events generated by this command are handled, it just means the command is executed by the command handler on CQRS command side. If you want to know when all the domain events are handled, you should listen to the DomainEventHandledMessage.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage.CommandId
member.summary: Represents the unique identifier of the command.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage.AggregateRootId
member.summary: Represents the aggregate root id associated with the command.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage.CommandStatus
member.summary: Represents the result status of the command.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage.ExceptionTypeName
member.summary: Represents the exception type name if the command has any exception.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Represents the error message if the command status is failed.

member.name: P:ENode.EQueue.CommandExecutedMessage.Items
member.summary: Represents the extension information of the command.
